pr_title: GEODE-7947 Implement tests for EXPIRE-related functionality

timeline.message: GEODE-7947 Implement tests for EXPIRE-related functionality

timeline.bodyText:
I noticed a warning raw use of paramtrized 'GenericContainer'.  Above on the line declaring redisContainer it might be nice to actually declare as GenericContainer<WHATEVER THE TYPE IS> redisContainer.  At the very least, you use empty angle brackers in the initialization new GenericContainer<>("redis:5.0.6")
Same comment for ExpireDockerAcceptanceTest and PexpireDockerAcceptanceTest
timeline.author: moleske

replies.bodyText: We added the "<>" operator as the simplest way to resolve it. I fully grasp why "tests extending tests" are generally a bad idea. In this case, though, we're trying to run the exact same tests against both Redis and Geode Redis, so this seems like the simplest way to get there.
replies.author: ringles

timeline.bodyText:
Since you were already in this file, might be worth making the line below use a capital "L"
long millisecondsToLive = 20000L
timeline.author: moleske

timeline.bodyText: rand is unused in the file.  And port below could be local to the setUp method
timeline.author: moleske

replies.bodyText: Good catch, "rand" was leftover from earlier tests.
replies.author: ringles

timeline.bodyText: 0L would be good here instead of 0l.
timeline.author: moleske

timeline.bodyText: The private final fields can all be local, except for ERROR_TIMESTAMP_NOT_USABLE which is unused
timeline.author: moleske

timeline.bodyText: You could remove the initialization if you want since it is redundant
timeline.author: moleske

timeline.bodyText: private finals could be local.  Though maybe since these are the same as ExpireAtExecutor they should be abstracted?  Though I would also wait for rule of three duplications...
timeline.author: moleske

timeline.bodyText: I see who's influence is here 😉
timeline.author: moleske
